meanings.definition: A particular form or variant of something.
meanings.sent1: I prefer the digital version of the book over the printed one.
meanings.sent2: The new version of the game includes exciting new features.
meanings.sent3: My sister's version of events always makes me laugh.
meanings.sent4: His version of the story was like a colorful painting.
meanings.sent5: The updated version of the recipe made it much tastier.

meanings.definition: A translation of a text into another language.
meanings.sent1: The Spanish version of the book is beautifully translated.
meanings.sent2: She is working on the French version of the document.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow sounded like a funny version of a song.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a poetic version of the original text.
meanings.sent5: The ancient version of the story was told in many languages.

meanings.definition: A particular edition or release of a piece of software or technology.
meanings.sent1: The latest version of the app fixed many bugs.
meanings.sent2: Downloading the new version of the software took only a few minutes.
meanings.sent3: The robot's malfunction was like a comical version of a software glitch.
meanings.sent4: The upgraded version of the device was a technological marvel.
meanings.sent5: The beta version of the game was full of exciting surprises.
